title: Practice-Based Learning Design for Optimizing Classroom Space Utilization

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of basic scientific concepts and experience using simple digital tools
context.additional_context: Course for aspiring early-career professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields to analyze classroom space usage patterns via smartphone-based data visualization and develop effective learning design skills

learning_goals: Learners can visualize classroom space usage patterns using at least three visual indicators (e.g., heatmaps, movement trajectories) by collecting and analyzing indoor location data
Learners can explain at least two ways classroom layout impacts learning engagement based on data visualization results.
Learners can propose three or more actionable improvements for actual classroom implementation using comparative spatial utilization data from peer teachers/learners.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
